p: NB protein is encoded by IBV at RNA segment 6 [ 116]. NB is modified by glycosylation and palmitoylation, with the latter being important for NB trafficking to the cell surface [ 117]. Purified NB has been found to form ion channels when incorporated into artificial lipid bilayers [ 118], and further studies on an NB-S20A mutant have resulted in altered proton permeability and channel gating [ 119]. However, in contrast to the BM2 protein, NB is not required for viral replication in cell culture [ 120]. IBV NB cannot modify pH within the TGN [ 107].
